titles.title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to require the reading of crime victims' rights in open court in criminal cases.
To amend title 18, United States Code, to require the reading of crime victims' rights in open court in criminal cases.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

bill.summary: Amends the federal criminal code to require the judge, at arraignment or at the commencement of a criminal trial, or at sentencing if there is no trial, to read in open court the rights of crime victims as provided by federal law.
